timeline.message: Added expand filter impl for R5 and dstu3, changed the filter logic

timeline.bodyText:
Hi, @frankjtao and @IanMMarshall.
What is the issue we're trying to solve here? What was the original request?
timeline.author: dmuylwyk
dmuylwyk

timeline.bodyText: This change warrants a changelog entry to indicate $expand with filter now evaluates the display with left-matching by string token, case-insensitive.
timeline.author: dmuylwyk

timeline.message: Revoked filter op to EQUAL and enabled NGramAnalyzer

timeline.bodyText:
After examining the changes in BaseTermReadSvcImpl more closely, I agree that enabling the "myDisplayNGram" in the addDisplayFilterInexact() method of BaseTermReadSvcImpl class is the correct solution here. That being said, I am now wondering if there is still a need for the applyFilter method in the FhirResourceDaoValueSet classes. I think this would only really be needed now for the case where HibernateSearch is not implemented.
Currently the BaseTermReadSvcImpl class disallows expand with filter in cases where HibernateSearch is not enabled. As such, I would say maybe remove this for now from the FhirResourceDaoValueSetDstu3, FhirResourceDaoValueSetR4 and FhirResourceDaoValueSetR5 classes.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

replies.bodyText: @IanMMarshall No. The applyFilter  method can't be removed in this case, since NGram Analyzer will return entry e.g.  for the display value of 'Systolic blood pressure' with the filter 'lood'. The applyFilter will return only left matching entries.
replies.author: frankjtao

timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: See comments above in FhirResourceDaoValueSetDstu3 and FhirResourceDaoValueSetR4.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest also adding a test for the expand with filter to the FhirResourceDaoR4SearchWithElasticSearchIT class as well to ensure that this change also works with the Elasticsearch mapping provider.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1084,7 +1084,7 @@ private void addDisplayFilterInexact(QueryBuilder qb, BooleanJunction<?> bool, V
 			.withSlop(2)
 			.onField("myDisplay").boostedTo(4.0f)
 			.andField("myDisplayEdgeNGram").boostedTo(2.0f)
-			// .andField("myDisplayNGram").boostedTo(1.0f)
+			.andField("myDisplayNGram").boostedTo(1.0f)

timeline.message: Rework on the expand issue replaced the EdgeAnalyzer
Changed name for new tokenFilter to make it unique.
Changed name for new tokenFilter to make it unique.
